scenarioDescription:
The HD 42012 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 42012 is a star with 0.83 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 120.02 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 42012 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 42012 system


HD 42012 b

HD 42012 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2017-05, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.67 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 42012 b is 508.800 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 42012 b is 13.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 42012 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 42012, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 42012 - System With 1 Exoplanet
